head.note: This manuscript record does not have a summary list of contents. For composite manuscripts, the list of contents can be found under each individual part.

listRelation.desc: This composite manuscript consists of 3 distinct parts:

altIdentifier.collection: William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838
William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

head.note: This manuscript contains: John Chyrsostom. The third part of the Commentary of John Chrysostom on the first Epistle of S. Paul to the Corinthians , homm. xxxiv.-xliv. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.author: John Chyrsostom
msItem.title: The third part of the Commentary of John Chrysostom on the first Epistle of S. Paul to the Corinthians , homm. xxxiv.-xliv.
msItem.rubric: ܦܢܩܝܬܐ ܕܬܠܬ ܕܦܘܫܩܐ ܕܐܓܪܬܐ ܩܕܡܝܬܐ̣ ܕܠܘܬ ܩܘܪ̈ܢܬܝܐ ܕܦܘܠܘܣ ܫܠܝܚܐ. ܕܩܕܝܫܐ ܝܘܚܢܢ ܕܩܘܣܛܢܛܝܢܦܘܠܝܣ
msItem.finalRubric: ܫܠܡ ܠܡܟܬܒ ܦܘܫܩܐ ܕܐܓܪܬܐ ܕܩܘܪ̈ܢܬܝܐ ܩܕܡܝܬܐ̣. ܕܦܘܠܘܣ ܫܠܝܚܐ ܛܘܒܢܐ: ܫܠܡ ܠܡܟܬܒ ܒܦܢܩܝܬܐ ܗܕܐ ܕܬܠܬ܆ ܕܦܘܫܩܐ ܕܠܘܬ ܩܘܪ̈ܢܬܝܐ ܩܕܡܝܬܐ̣. ܡܐܡܪ̈ܐ ܚܕܥܣܪ̈. ܕܦܘܠܘܣ ܫܠܝܚܐ. ܕܥ̇ܒܝܕܝܢ ܠܩܕܝܫܐ ܝܘܚܢܢ ܐܦܣܩܦܐ ܕܩܘܣܛܢܛܝܢܦܘܠܝܣ: ܐܬܦܫܩܘ ܕܝܢ ܡܢ ܠܫܢܐ ܝܘܢܝܐ̣ ܠܐܪܡܝܐ̣. ܒܩܠܝܢܝܩܘܣ ܡܕܝܢܬܐ. ܀ Two and a half lines erased. ܐܠܗܐ ܕܝܢ ܪܚܡ ܒ̈ܢܝ ܐܢܫܐ ܢܥܒܕ ܪ̈ܚܡܐ ܥܠ ܐܝܠܝܢ ܕܐܠܝܘ ܘܫܚ̣ܩ ܒܦܢܩܝܬܐ ܗܕܐ. ܘܢܫܘܐ ܐܢܘܢ̣ ܏ܘܫ.
msItem.note: In this manuscript there is also another division into sections, numbered from 38 to 48. The translation was made in the city ofCallinicus (al-Rak-kah,).

listBibl.bibl: Migne, Patrol. Gr., t. lxi., col. 285

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 10 1/8 in. by 6 3/4, consisting of 108 leaves. Thequires, 11 in number, are signed with both arithmetical figures and letters; a later hand has renumbered them with letters only. Each page is divided into two columns, of from 32 to 34 lines. This manuscript is written in a fine, regular Estrangělā, and dated A. Gr. 895, A.D. 584. Foll. 54, 55, 64, 65, 91 and 98, are in a different and somewhat later hand.

collation.p: The quires, 11 in number, are signed with both arithmetical figures and letters; a later hand has renumbered them with letters only.

layout.p: Each page is divided into two columns, of from 32 to 34 lines.

handNote.desc: This manuscript is written in a fine, regular Estrangělā, and datedA. Gr. 895,A.D. 584.
A later hand has numbered the quires with letters only.
Foll.54, 55,64, 65,91, and98are in a different and somewhat later hand.

additions.note: N.B., folio location may not be available for some items below.
N.B., items below may have been listed out of folio order in Wright's catalogue.

item.label: Colophon
item.p: The first note on fol. 107a gives us the name of the scribe, the deaconThomas of Edessa:

p.quote: ܥܠ ܬܐܘܡܐ ܫܡܫܐ ܐܘܪܗܝܐ ܕܟܬ̣ܒ ܦܢܩܝܬܐ ܗܕܐ ܕܐܠܗܐ ܢܚ̇ܢܝ̣ܘܗܝ ܏ܘܫ.

item.label: Colophon
item.p: Another note informs us that the book was written in the year895,A.D. 584, in the convent of Gubbā Barrāyā ܓܘܒܐ ܒܪܝܐ . SeeAssemani, Bibl. Or., t. ii., Dissert. De Monoph. Art. Ix., for the use of the abbat,Thomasand the rest of the brotherhood.

p.quote: ܐܫܬܠܡܬ ܦܢܩܝܬܐ ܗܕܐ ܒܐܝܪܚ ܬܡܘܙ ܒܥܣܪܝܢ ܘܬܫܥܐ ܒܗ ܕܫܢܬ ܬܡܢܡܐܐ ܘܬܫܥܝܢ ܘܚܡܫ ܒܥܘܡܪܐ ܩܕܝܫܐ ܕܓܘܒܐ ܒܪܝܐ. ܐܬܚܦܛ ܕܝܢ ܘܣܡ ܣܝܡܬܐ ܗܕܐ ܪܘܚܢܝܬܐ܆ ܠܩܪܝܢܐ ܘܠܝܘܬܪܢܐ ܕܓܘܐ ܟܠܗ ܕܡܗ̈ܝܡܢܐ̣. ܡܝܬܪܐ ܘܪܚܡ ܐܠܗܐ. ܘܐܚܝܕ ܐܚܘܬܐ ܒܪܚܡܬ ܡܪܗ. ܬܐܘܡܐ ܪܝܫܕܝܪܐ ܕܝܠܗ ܕܥܘܡܪܐ. ܥܡ ܫܪܟܐ ܕܩܫܝ̈ܫܢܐ ܘܡܫ̈ܡܫܢܐ ܘܐܚܘܬܐ ܟܠܗ̇ ܕܥܡܗ. ܗܠܝܢ ܕܡܛܠ ܚܘܒܗ ܕܡܫܝܚܐ: ܘܡܛܠ ܡܘܠܟܢܐ ܕܡ̣ܠܟ܆ ܫܒܩܘ ܐܒ̈ܗܝܗܘܢ ܘܐܚ̈ܝܗܘܢ̣. ܘܐܚܒܘ ܨܘܡܐ ܢܓܝܪܐ ܘܫܗܪܐ ܘܟܠܗܝܢ ܐܢܢ̈ܩܣ ܕܦܓܪܐ. ܕܐܠܗܐ ܏ܘܫ. ܟܠ ܕܝܢ ܕܫܐܠ ܠܗ̇ ܠܦܢܩܝܬܐ ܗܕܐ ܕܢܩܪܐ ܐܘ ܕܢܦܚܡ ܐܘ ܕܢܟܬܘܒ ܡܢܗ̇ ܘܟܐܡ̇ ܥܠܝܗ ܐܘ ܦܣܩ ܡܢܗ̇ ܡܕܡ܆ ܗܘܐ ܝܕܥ̇ ܕܩܕܡ ܒܝܡ ܕܚܝܠܬܐ ܕܐܠܗܐ ܝ̇ܗܒ ܦܬܓܡܐ ܐܝܟ ܡܚܠܨ ܒܝܬ ܡܩܕܫܐ܀

item.p: From a note on fol. 108a we learn that it was purchased by the monksMarcus,MārūthāandAthanasiusofRās'ain, residing in the desert ofScete, in the year1181,A.D. 870.

p.quote: ܒܫܦܝܪܘܬ ܨܒܝܢܐ ܛ̇ܒܐ: ܘܒܚܘܝܚܘܬ ܬܪܥܝܬܐ ܪܚܡ̇ܬ ܠܐܠܗܐ܇ ܡܛܠ ܝܘܬܪܢܐ ܕܢܦܫܗܘܢ ܏ܘܫ ܝ̣ܨܦܘ ܘܩܢ̣ܘ̇ ܣܡܝܡܬܐ ܗܕܐ ܪܘܚܢܝܬܐ̇. ܏ܘܫ ܐܚ̈ܐ ܢܟ̈ܦܐ ܘܕܝܪ̈ܝܐ ܟܢܝ̈ܟܐ: ܡܐܪܩܘܣ ܘܡܪܘܬܐ ܘܐܬܢܣ. ܕܡܢ ܪܝܫܥܝܢܐ ܡܕܝܢܬܐ. ܕܐܠܗܐ ܕܡܛܠ ܫܡܗ܇ ܏ܘܫ. ܐܬܪܫ̣ܡ ܥܘܗܕܢܐ ܗܢܐ. ܫܢܬ ܐܠܦܐ ܘ܏ܩܦܐ ܒܡܕܒܪܐ ܩܕܝܫܐ ܕܐܣܩܝܛܐ.܀.

item.p:
It seems, however, to have been subsequently taken away from theconvent of S. Mary Deipara, to which it was restored byPaul bar Yāyē of Tagrit,A. Gr. 1243,A.D. 932. SeeAssemani, Bibl. Orient., t. ii., p. 78. The name may, however, be read
ܢܐܢܐ Nonnus
.

p.quote: ܘܥܠ ܦܘܠܘܣ ܒܪ ܝܐܝܐ ܬܓܪܬܢܝܐ ܪܚ̈ܡܐ ܕܐܠܗܐ ܢܗܘܢ ܥܠܘܗܝ ܕܗܘ ܥܒܕ ܝܨܝܦܘܬܐ ܘܐܥܛܦܗ ܠܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܩܕܝܫܐ ܠܕܝܪܐ ܕܐܣܩܛܐ ܩܕܝܫܐ. ܐܝܬܘܗܝ ܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܕܕܝܪܐ ܕܣܘܪܝܝܐ ܕܒܝܬ ܝܠܕܬ ܐܠܗܐ ܕܒܡܕܒܪܐ ܕܣ̈ܩܛܐ ܕܐܒܐ ܒܝܫܘܝ ܐܠܐ ܟܠ ܕܫܩܠ ܠܗ ܐܘ ܡܦܩ ܠܗ ܡܢ ܗܕܐ ܕܝܪܐ ܕܐܡܝܪܐ ܢܗܘܐ ܚܪܡ ܏ܘܫ..

item.p: On fol. 107b there is a prayer for one'Abbās bar Tūbānā, his sonsJacob,SergiusandYeshūa', his wifeShabhār, and his daughtersMānāand‘A,isha.

p.quote: ܠܡܪܝ ܥ݊ܒ݊ܐܣ݊ ܒܪ ܛܘܒܢܐ ܘ݊ܠܝܥܩ݊ܘܒ݊ ܘ݊ܠܣ݊ܪܓܣ݊ ܘ݊ܠܝܫ݊ܘ݊ܥ ܒ̈ܢܝܐ ܕܝܠܗ. ܘܠܩܘܪܐ (κυρίαorκυρά) ܫ݊ܒ݊ܗ݊ܐܪ ܒܪܬ ܙܘܓܗ. ܘ݊ܠܡ݊ܐܢ݊ܐ ܘܠܥ݊ܝ݊ܫ݊ܐ ܒܢ̈ܬܗ. ܐܠܗܐ ܢܢ̇ܛܪ. ܘܢܫܘܙܒ. ܘܢܦܨܐ. ܘܢܣ̇ܬܪ ܬܚܝܬ ܟܢ̈ܦܐ ܕܡܪܚܡܢܘܬܗ. ܡܢ ܒܝ̣ܫܐ ܘܚܝ̈ܠܘܬܗ. ܘܢܫܟܢ ܠܗܘܢ ܚܘܣܝܐ ܕܚܘ̈ܒܐ. ܘܫܘܒܩܢܐ ܕܚ̈ܛܗܐ. ܘܡܠܐܟܐ ܕܫܝܢܐ ܘܕܫܠܡܐ. ܘܡܦܩܢܐ ܟܪܣܛܝܢܝܐ. ܘܫܘܙܒܐ ܕܡܢ ܠܒܘܟܝܐ ܘܐܘܚܕܢܐ ܕܒܝܠ ܐܐ̇ܪ. ܘܩܘܡܐ ܕܡܢ ܝܡܝܢܗ. ܘܒܘܣܡܐ ܕܒܡܠܟܘܬܗ. ܒ̈ܨܠܘܬܐ ܘܒ̈ܥܘܬܐ ܕܝܠܕܬ ܠܐܠܗܐ ܡܪܬܐ ܕܝܠܢ ܡ݊ܪܝ݊ܡ݊: ܘܒܨ̈ܠܘܬܐ ܕܟܠܗܘܢ ܩ̈ܕܝܫܐ ܠܥܠܡ ܥܠܡܝܢ ܐܡܝܢ: ܀ : ܀ ܕܟܝܪܝܢ ܟܠܗܘܢ ܩ̈ܕܝܫܐ ܘܨܠܘܬܗܘܢ ܬܥ̇ܕܪ ܠܢ܀

item.p: The last two lines of arithmetical figures are to be read:ܝܘܚܢܢ ܛܘܒܢܐ ܕܒܝܬ ܒܐܠܫ, John the monk of Beth-Bālesh .

Fol. 1a exhibits the wordsܟܘܪܣܐ ܩܕܡܝܬܐ ܕܦܢܩܝܬܐ ܕܬܠܐ ܕܐܓܪܬܐ ܕܩܘܪܢܬܝܐ ܩܕܡܝܬܐ ܥܠ ܚܝܠܗ ܕܡܪܢ ܡܫܪܝܢܢ, written in a smaller, but ancient, cursive character. Above, are the letters I. PP, and beneath, in Arabic,.
A marginal note on fol. 2b and 3a enumerates theother worksnow bound with this manuscript:

quote.sic: ܘܬܘܒ ܬܫܥܝܬܐ ܥܠ ܐܒܪܗܡ ܩܝܢܕܘܢܝܐ. ـܲـ ܘܥܠ ܝܘܼܠܝܢܐ ــܲـ ܘܥܠ ܓܒܪܐ ܕܐܠܗܐ ــܲـ ܘܥܠ ܦܘܠܐ ܝܘܚܢܢ ــܲـ ܘܥܠ ܛܠܝ̈ܐ ܕܐܦܣܘܣ ــܲـ ܘܥܠ ܓܡܝ̣ܪܘܬܐ ــܲـ ܘܥܠ ܡܪܬܝܢܘܬܐ ܕܡܪܝ ܟܣܣܛܘܣ.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

altIdentifier.collection: William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838
William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

head.note: This manuscript contains: Lives of Saints. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 6 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.author: Ephraim
msItem.title:
The life of
Abraham Kidunaya ܡܪܝ ܐܒܪܗܡ ܩܝܕܘܢܝܐ

listBibl.bibl: Assemani, Bibl. Orient., t. i., pp. 38, 396
Ephraem Syri Opera, ed. Rom., t. ii., p. 1
Acta Sanctt. for March, t. ii., p. 436

msItem.author: Theodoret of Cyrrhus
msItem.title: The life ofJulian Saba, or the Aged
msItem.note:
It is also ascribed toEphraim(seeAssemani, Bibl. Orient., t. i., pp. 33, 154, 397), but is in reality byTheodoret(seeOpera, ed. Schulze, t. iii., p. 1119;Acta Sanctt. for October, t. viii., p. 353; and
Add. 14,612, fol. 179a
, where this andthe life ofJacob of Nisibis are expressly said to be taken from the
Philotheus ܦܝܠܬܐܘܣ
).

msItem.title: The history of theMan of Godfrom the city ofRomewho lived in the time ofRabulas, bishop ofEdessa
msItem.rubric: ܬܫܥܝܬܐ ܕܥܠ ܓܒܪܐ ܕܐܠܗܐ ܕܡܢ ܪܗܘܡܐ ܡܕܝܢܬܐ̣. ܕܐܬܢܨܚ ܘܐܬܟܠܠ ܒܡܣܪܩܘܬܐ ܘܒܥܡܠܐ ܕܡܛܠ ܡܫܝܚܐ̇. ܒܝ̈ܘܡܝ ܩܕܝܫܐ ܡܪܝ ܪܒܘܠܐ ܐܦܣܩܦܐ ܕܐܘܪܗܝ..
msItem.note: Wrightrefers to the Man of God asAlexius Romanus.

listBibl.bibl: Assemani, Bibl. Orient., t. i., p. 401, t. ii., pp. 19, 285

msItem.title: The history ofPaul the bishopandJohn the priest
msItem.rubric: ܢܨܚ̈ܢܐ ܕܛܘܒ̈ܢܐ ܦܘܠܐ ܐܦܣܩܦܐ̣ ܘܕܝܘܚܢܢ ܩܫܝܫܐ
msItem.note: Paul is said to have left his own city inItaly,ܦܢܛܘܣ ܡܕܝܢܬܐ ܕܐܝܛܠܝܐ(fol.135b), and to have gone toEdessa,ܐܘܪܗܝ ܕܦܪ̈ܬܘܝܐ, in the time ofRabulas(fol.136a). Of thislatter city Johnwas an inhabitant.

msItem.title: The history of the Youths of Ephesus (the Seven Sleepers)
msItem.note: The text commences with the passage corresponding to theActa Sanctt. for July, t. vi., p. 394, paragraph 12. The youths are, however, said to be 8 in number (seeAssemani, Bibl. Or., t. i., p. 335; Acta Sanctt., p. 376), fol.151a:ܡܢ ܩܕܡ ܕܩܝܣ ܡ̇ܠܟܐ ܥܪܩܘ̣. ܡܟܣܡܠܝܢܐ ܒܪ ܗܘܦܪܟܐ. ܘܝܡܠܝܟܐ̣ ܘܡܪܛܠܘܣ. ܘܕܝܢܘܣܣ ܘܝܘܐܢܝܣ̣ ܘܣܪܦܝܘܢ. ܘܐܟܣܩܘܣܛܕܝܢܣ ܘܐܢܛܘܢܝܢܗ ܡܘ̈ܕܝܢܐ ܗܠܝܢ.This seems to be the first of thetwo very ancient Syriac manuscriptswhichAssemanisaw in theconvent of S. Mary Deipara, and which he describes in theBibl. Or., t. iii., pars i., p. 19. It appears to have been in much the same state then,A.D. 1715, as it is now.

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 10 1/8 in. by 6 3/4, consisting of 77 leaves (see Add. 12,160, foll. 153-185 ). The quires were originally at least 15 in number; but ܐ, ܘ, ܙ, ܚ, ܛ, ܝ, and ܝܗ are entirely lost, and ܒ is imperfect, a leaf being wanting after fol, 109, and another after fol. 115. They are signed with both letters and arithmetical figures, but a later hand has renumbered them with letters only. Each page is divided into two columns, of from 25 to 33 lines.

collation.p: The quires were originally at least 15 in number and are signed with both letters and arithmetical figures.

item.p: Quiresܐ,ܘ,ܙ,ܚ,ܛ, andܝare entirely lost, andܒis imperfect, a leaf being wanting after fol,109, and another after fol.115.

layout.p: Each page is divided into two columns, of from 25 to 33 lines.

handNote.desc: The writing of this larger portion is a fine, regular Estrangela of the latter half of the vith cent.

additions.note: N.B., folio location may not be available for some items below.

item.p: A later hand has renumbered the quires with letters only.

origin.origDate: the latter half of the vith cent.

head.note: This manuscript contains: Discourses by different writers. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 3 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Discourse
msItem.rubric: ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܫܬܬܥܣܪ̈ ܕܥܠ ܦܘܪܫܐ ܕܐܘܪܚܐ ܕܓܡܝܪܘܬܐ ܡܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܡ̈ܣܩܬܐ

rubric.fw: ܥܠ ܦܘܿܪܫܐ ܕܐܘܪܚܐ ܕܓܡܝܪܘܬܐ. ܡܢ ܡܐܡܪܐ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܡܬ݂ܩܪܐ ܕܡ̈ܣܩܬܐ

msItem.incipit: ܗܒ ܠܝ ܗܟܝܠ ܐܕܢ̈ܝ ܡܕܥܟ܇ ܐܘ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܨ̇ܒܐ ܕܢܗܘܐ ܝܚܝܕܝܐ̇. ܘܚܦܝܛ ܕܢܐܙܠ ܒܥܓܠ ܠܡܕܝܢܬܗܘܢ ܕܡܪܢ ܝܫܘܥ̣. ܘܐܢܐ ܡܚ̇ܘܐ ܐܢܐ ܠܟ̇. ܐܝܟܢ ܬܐܙܠ ܠܡܕܝܢܬܗ ܕܡܠܟܢ܇ ܐܢ ܐܝܬ ܒܟ ܚ̣ܝܠܐ ܕܬܪܕܐ ܐܝܟ ܕܡܚ̇ܘܐ ܐܢܐ ܠܟ. ܡܛܠ ܕܩ̣̈ܫܝܢ ܡܣ̈ܩܬܐ ܕܬ̇ܪܨ ܐܢܐ ܠܟ ܕܬܣܩ ܒܗܝܢ..
msItem.note:
From this Κλῖμαξ, orLadder,there are extracts in several other manuscripts, in one of which it is ascribed toEusebius the monk, viz.,
Add. 17,193, fol. 3a
,ܕܐܘܣܒܝܣ ܝܚܝܕܝܐ ܡܢ ܟܬܒܐ ܕܥܒܝܕ ܠܗ ܕܡܣ̈ܩܬܐ..

msItem.author: Xystus
msItem.title: The second discourse of Xystus, bishop ofRome
msItem.rubric: ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܬܪ̈ܝܢ ܕܡܪܝ ܟܣܘܣܛܘܣ ܐܦܣܩܦܐ ܕܪܗܘܡܐ ܡܕܝܢܬܐ

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 10 1/8 in. by 6 3/4, consisting of 77 leaves (see Add. 12,160, foll. 109-152 ). The quires were originally at least 15 in number; but ܐ, ܘ, ܙ, ܚ, ܛ, ܝ, and ܝܗ are entirely lost, and ܒ is imperfect. They are signed with both letters and arithmetical figures, but a later hand has renumbered them with letters only. Each page is divided into two columns, of from 25 to 33 lines.

collation.p: See Part 2 above.The quires were originally at least 15 in number and are signed with both letters and arithmetical figures.

layout.p: Each page is divided into two columns, of from 25 to 33 lines.

handNote.desc: The writing on these leaves is neatly written in a more current hand of theviith cent.

additions.note: N.B., folio location may not be available for some items below.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.

category.catDesc: Catenae Patrum and Demonstrations against Heresies
Councils of the Church and Ecclesiastical Canons

langUsage.language: Unvocalized Syriac of any variety or period
Arabic Garshuni in Vocalized West Syriac Script
Arabic Garshuni in Vocalized East Syriac Script
